news_header: Philippines offers cash for mosquitoes to combat dengue outbreak amid rising cases.
news_original_title: Philippine town offers bounty for mosquitoes as dengue rises
news_text: Authorities in the Philippines are offering a cash reward for mosquitoes to combat a dengue outbreak. The initiative, announced by Barangay Addition Hills chief Carlito Cernal, aims to reduce mosquito populations following a spike in dengue cases, including two student deaths. The program offers one peso for every five mosquitoes and will run for at least a month. While the bounty has faced ridicule on social media, local health officials support efforts to combat dengue, urging evidence-based practices.
